How to make Notion into a website?
Search
Duplicate
Notion
How to make Notion into a website?
❗
This tutorial will be difficult to follow without prior knowledge of the terminal and Python.
This tutorial uses Loconotion. It is an open-source Github repository in Python that exports a Notion page to static website. You might ask why use Loconotion if Notion has an export feature natively? As explained in the repository's README document, it brings back the clean design and the functionality of many blocks that were removed during native export. You can learn more about what the script does exactly by accessing the repo. Here are the steps I took from a Notion page to a Static HTML website.
1. Download the repository.
Access the repository from here.
leoncvlt/loconotion
Turn Notion pages into lightweight, customizable static websites - leoncvlt/loconotion
https://github.com/leoncvlt/loconotion
Via Direct Download
You can download the repository as a Zip file from the repository. Unzip the file to your desired folder in your computer.
Via Git
You can git clone the repository from your terminal. Do not forget to cd first to your desired location in your computer.
2. Install Python (with Pip)
You can simply google search 'python download' and the official download website should appear. Though, the best way for me to get Python is through homebrew. Homebrew is a package distribution manager which allows users to download packages and executables via the command line - perfect for those who want to automate package and application installation in their computer. You can install homebrew through this command:
/bin/bash -c "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/Homebrew/install/master/install.sh)"
Bash
Now that you have homebrew installed, you can simply install python and pip with this simple command:
brew install python
Bash
This should install the latest python distribution (python3) and automatically install pip (pip3).
3. Install the required Python libraries.
Open terminal to the folder containing the repo files and run this command
pip3 install -r requirements.txt
Bash
4. Make your Notion page public and export!
Go to the Notion page you wish to convert to a static website. Click on the Share button on the top right corner of the page and toggle on 'Share to web'. Copy the link. Now go open the terminal to the folder containing the repo files again and type this command. Do not forget to replace the placeholder with the linked you copied of the Notion page.
python3 loconotion YOUR_COPIED_LINK_HERE
Bash
Give it time to work and viola! You should have your files in the dist folder. Now you can upload these HTML files to your preferred hosting service, for me, that is Github Pages. Good luck and enjoy!
